4.4 Training

The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant trains personnel in the operating procedures to help ensure safe and effective performance of their assigned tasks. A record of all training is maintained to help ensure new and refresher training is provided on a timely basis.

4.5 Maintenance 

The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant properly maintains the equipment in our processes. The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant maintenance program includes:

1. procedures to safely guide workers in their maintenance tasks,
2. worker training in the maintenance procedures, and
3. inspection and testing program to help identify equipment deterioration and damage before equipment fails.

4.6 Compliance Audits

The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant performs periodic (at least every three years) audits of covered processes to verify the processes are operating in compliance with the requirements of the RMP Rule. A compliance audit report is prepared after each audit, and any deficiencies noted by the audit are corrected in a timely manner.

4.7 Incident Investigations

The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant investigates all incidents that could reasonably have resulted in a serious injury to personnel, the public, or the environment. The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant trains employees to identify and report any and all incidents requiring investigation. An investigation team is assembled and the investigation is initiated within 48 hours of the incident. The results of the investigation are documented, recommendations are resolved, and appropriate process enhancements are implemented.

4.8 Chemical-specific Prevention Steps - Process chemicals

Industry standards are followed at The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatmen

t Plant to help ensure safe handling of process chemicals. The vendor supplies chlorine and sulfur dioxide via a Department of Transportation (DOT) approved truck and in DOT approved 1 ton cylinders. The process equipment is designed and constructed with state-of-the-art materials and technology utilizing the standards and guidelines of the Chlorine Institute, American Water Works Association, ASME, ANSI, and other applicable codes. Workers who perform operations involving chlorine and sulfur dioxide receive training emphasizing safe handling procedures according to the guidelines required by The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant.

5.0 Five Year Accident History
There has been no accidents or incidents that resulted in injuries to employee, the public, or the environment at The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant in the past five years.

6.0 Emergency Response Programs

The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant has prepared a written emergency action plan that complies with the RMP Rule, other federal standards and industry guidelines. This plan has been communicated to the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and local fire department. 

7.0 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant continuously attempts to improve the safety of our processes to protect our employees, the public and the environment. The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant incident investigations, employee suggestions and improvements in technology are utilized to update the safety aspects of the processes.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.0	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant is committed to the safety of our workers, the public, and the environment. The resources invested in the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances demonstrate this commitment. The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant implements reasonable controls, such as training of personnel and the safe design, installation, operation and maintenance of our processes. Our policy is to make every effort to prevent the release of hazardous substances but in the event of a release, our trained personnel will coordinate with local emergency response agencies and first responders to control and contain the release in a manner that will be safe for workers and will help prevent injuries to the public or the environment.

2.0 Description of The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant and Regulated Substances

The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant handles two substances regulated by the Risk Management Plan Rule (RMP Rule) in quantities above the Threshold Quantity. These substances are:

* Chlorine - stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for disinfection of the water.
* Sulfur dioxide- stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for dechlorination of water.

3.0 Hazard Assessment

The RMP Rule requires The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant to perform a Hazard Assessment of the regulated substances stored and used in the covered processes at the facility. This Hazard Assessment includes an offsite consequence analysis for the following scenarios:

* One worst-case and one alternative release scenario for each of the toxic substances sulfur dioxide and chlorine used in the disinfection and dechlorination of effluent at the facility. The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant completed a H

azard Assessment for the covered processes and the results have been appropriately communicated to the local emergency response agencies. The Hazard Assessment has been recently updated to reflect changes in population.

4.0 Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

The RMP Rule requires that a prevention program be established for The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant disinfection process. The following details the prevention program elements at The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant that apply to these processes.

4.1 Safety Information

The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant maintains a variety of technical documents that are used to help ensure safe operation of The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant processes. Safety data sheets (SDSs) document the physical and chemical properties of hazardous substances handled at The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant, including chlorine and sulfur dioxide used in the covered process. The engineering design documents include the operating parameters, the design basis and configuration of the equipment in each covered process, and references to applicable codes and standards. 
	
4.2 Hazard Review

The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant performs and periodically updates hazard reviews of the covered processes to help identify and control process hazards. Checklists are used to guide the hazard review. These checklists include items to help ensure The Searcy Water Utilities Wastewater Treatment Plant operates and maintains the equipment in a manner consistent with the applicable design specifications, codes, standards, and regulations.
